questions.text: What song did the people at the bar sing to Carla's daughter over the phone?
questions.explanation:
Irish Lullaby.

	The lyrics to the "Irish Lullaby" are: "Over in Killarney Many years ago, Me Mither sang a song to me In tones so sweet and low. Just a simple little ditty, In her good ould Irish way, And l'd give the world if she could sing That song to me this day. Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral, Too-ra-loo-ra-li, Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral, hush now, don't you cry!Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral, Too-ra-loo-ra-li, Too-ra-loo-ra-loo-ral, that's an Irish lullaby." After they sang the song and they got her daughter to sleep, they all yelled, waking her up again.

Cliff.

	Cliff worked for the United Postal Service. Cliff was often obnoxious and as a result Carla did not like him.

Norm.

	Norm had not had a job in a long time. Cliff offered to loan him the money thinking he would turn it down, but he was surprised when Norm accepted.

questions.text: Who managed the little league team?
questions.explanation:
Coach.

	Coach used to be a third base coach for the Boston Red Sox. When he heard they needed a little league manager he suggested that he would do it but thought it was a crazy idea. Sam told him it was not crazy at all.

questions.text: What did Sam reply when Carla asked how he felt about breastfeeding?
questions.explanation:
"As I recall I liked it."

	Carla wanted to breastfeed her daughter at the bar because it was too hard to keep running home to feed her. Sam misunderstood and thought she wanted to know what he thought of breastfeeding when he was a baby.

questions.text: What was the name of the little league team?
questions.explanation:
Titans.

	The first thing that the team worked on was nicknames. Coach turned out to be a mean manager because all he cared about was winning.

questions.text: Who did Cliff and Norm make baby noises at?
questions.explanation:
A duck.

	They thought the baby was in the carriage so they were making baby noises at it. However, it turned out Carla had the baby with her and it was a stuffed duck in the carriage.

questions.text: What did Diane say the manager of the little league team had become?
questions.explanation:
a tyrant.

	Coach insulted the kids when they didn't play well. He got so bad the entire team quit on him.

questions.text: What did Diane say the team needed?
questions.explanation:
fun.

	Coach realized how hard he had been on the team and changed. He was reminded when he thought of a bad teacher he had that made him miserable.

Coach.

	Coach was in the office when Carla burped her baby. He said he wished someone would do that for him, so she burped him as well.
